meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impractical.
meanings.sent1: The impracticality of bringing a surfboard to a desert shows its lack of usefulness.
meanings.sent2: The team decided against the plan due to the impracticality of implementing it within the given timeframe.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to juggle flaming torches while riding a unicycle highlighted the impracticality of his circus act.
meanings.sent4: The artist's insistence on using only rare, expensive materials showcased the impracticality of his approach to art.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's demonstration of building a house of cards illustrated the fragility and impracticality of the structure.

meanings.sent1: The project was abandoned due to the impracticality of the proposed budget.
meanings.sent2: She realized the impracticality of trying to fit all her clothes into a single suitcase.
meanings.sent3: The chef's idea of serving ice cream with hot sauce highlighted the impracticality of his culinary experiment.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promise to lower taxes for everyone exposed the impracticality of his campaign rhetoric.
meanings.sent5: The architect's design, while visually stunning, suffered from the impracticality of its layout.
